intro: Cryptantha nana var. shantzii, commonly known as the dwarf cryptantha, is a small, annual flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or gravelly soils, often in open areas such as disturbed sites or along roadsides. Its small stature and delicate appearance make it a subtle yet distinctive member of its ecosystem. The variety shantzii is distinguished by its unique morphological traits, including smaller leaves and floral structures compared to other varieties of Cryptantha nana.
